Kankakee Valley School Corporation bus drivers continue to see stop-arm violations each week. In order to help us keep our students safe, please remember:

School buses are like traffic signals:
• When overhead lights are flashing yellow: Prepare to stop
• When overhead lights are flashing red: Stop
• When hazard warning lights are flashing: Proceed with caution.

School bus safety tips for drivers:
• Prepare to stop when a slowing bus has its overhead yellow lights flashing
• Stop at least 20 feet away for buses when red lights are flashing, unless driving in the opposite direction on a divided highway
• Slow down in or near school and residential areas
• Look for clues-such as safety patrols, crossing guards, bicycles, and playgrounds-that indicate children might be in the area
• Watch for children between parked cars and other objects.

Please help us keep students safe by stopping for buses and spreading the word!

A new law designed to keep children safe at their bus stops in several different ways will take effect on July 1, 2019. Kankakee Valley has already taken many steps over the last year to adjust routes and increase student safety. As we start a new school year, more adjustments will be made to do all that we can to keep our students safe while traveling to and from school. More information on route changes will be shared in the coming weeks.

The law promotes same side pickups and drops off to prevent children from having to cross high-speed roads or highways. It increases penalties for violators caught ignoring a stopped school bus. It allows schools to petition for funding to pay for stop arm cameras and getting an Indiana driver’s license, will require more awareness about school bus safety laws.

Please help us keep students safe by stopping for buses and spreading the word!

By creating a Personalized Family Media Use Plan, you can be aware of when you are using media to achieve your purpose. This requires parents & users to think about what they want those purposes to be. Kankakee Valley schools will be closed Tuesday through Thursday. Today is an eLearning Day. However, Wednesday and Thursday will not be eLearning days and will be made up as a planned eLearning Days on the two scheduled make-up days, February 15 and April 22. This follows the KV eLearning Plan and is supported by evidence showing that the level of learning on the third and fourth day decreases significantly and it would benefit students to take these days off and make them up at a later time.
Additionally, all school buildings and offices will be closed Wednesday due to the extremely dangerous temperatures. Thank you for your continued support through this challenging winter weather.
